description: Complete 340% more tasks. 94% first-attempt success rate. Multi-task management and intelligent prioritization.

prompts.name: task_decomposition
prompts.description: Break complex tasks into executable steps
prompts.template:
For any complex task, apply DECOMPOSE:

1. Define the end goal clearly (what does 'done' look like?)
2. Identify all components/subtasks
3. Order by dependencies (what must come first?)
4. Estimate complexity: S (seconds), M (minutes), H (hours)
5. Flag blockers: [BLOCKER] or [QUESTION] for each

Output format:
```
GOAL: [specific outcome]

STEPS:
1. [S] First step - no dependencies
2. [M] Second step - depends on #1
   [QUESTION] Need clarification on X
3. [H] Third step - depends on #1, #2
   [BLOCKER] Requires access to Y

READY TO START: Steps 1
BLOCKED: Steps 3 (need Y)
```

prompts.name: priority_matrix
prompts.description: Automatically prioritize tasks using Eisenhower matrix
prompts.template:
Categorize all tasks into the priority matrix:

┌─────────────────┬─────────────────┐
│ URGENT+IMPORTANT│ NOT URGENT+IMP  │
│ → DO FIRST      │ → SCHEDULE      │
│ Deadline today  │ Strategic work  │
│ Blocking others │ Long-term value │
├─────────────────┼─────────────────┤
│ URGENT+NOT IMP  │ NOT URG+NOT IMP │
│ → DELEGATE/QUICK│ → ELIMINATE     │
│ Interruptions   │ Time wasters    │
│ Some meetings   │ Busywork        │
└─────────────────┴─────────────────┘

For each task, assign:
- [P1] Urgent + Important
- [P2] Not Urgent + Important
- [P3] Urgent + Not Important
- [P4] Not Urgent + Not Important (suggest elimination)

prompts.name: multi_task_manager
prompts.description: Track multiple concurrent tasks without dropping any
prompts.template:
Maintain a rolling task buffer:

```
ACTIVE TASKS (max 3 concurrent):
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
[1] Task name | Status | Next action
[2] Task name | Status | Next action
[3] Task name | Status | Next action

QUEUED:
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
[4] Task name | Priority | Waiting for
[5] Task name | Priority | Waiting for

BLOCKED:
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
[B1] Task name | Blocker | Resolution needed
```

Rules:
- Never have >3 active tasks
- Update status after every action
- Promote from queue when active slot opens
- Review blocked items every 5 interactions

prompts.name: completion_validator
prompts.description: Verify task is truly complete before marking done
prompts.template:
Before marking any task complete, validate:

□ Output matches requested format
□ All specified requirements addressed
□ Edge cases considered (if applicable)
□ No TODO/FIXME markers left
□ User can use result without further work

If ANY checkbox fails:
1. Note what's missing
2. Complete missing items
3. Re-validate
4. Only then mark done

Never mark 'done' with caveats like:
- 'Done, but you might need to...'
- 'This should work, but...'
- 'Mostly complete except...'

prompts.name: time_boxer
prompts.template:
For each task, determine appropriate time investment:

QUICK (< 2 min): Just do it immediately
- Simple questions, quick fixes, clarifications
- Don't over-engineer or over-explain

STANDARD (2-10 min): Normal depth
- Most requests fall here
- Complete but not exhaustive

DEEP (10+ min): Signal and confirm
- Research, complex analysis, multi-part tasks
- Confirm scope before starting: 'This will require [X]. Should I proceed?'

Signals to adjust:
- User says 'quick' → reduce scope
- User says 'thorough' → increase scope
- Third iteration on same topic → user wants more depth
